meaningMnemonic: If you try to turn something into <radical>ice</radical> while having <radical>doubt</radical>s, it will just <kanji>congeal</kanji> instead. It will <kanji>freeze</kanji>, but it will get kinda yucky too. Your doubts will affect the ice-making process, so try not to be so worried and unsure next time you want normal ice.
readingMnemonic: You always end up <kanji>congeal</kanji>ing your <reading>gyo</reading>za (ぎょう) this way. You want to <kanji>freeze</kanji> your leftover gyoza so you can enjoy it later, but you doubt it will turn out all right and it always congeals in a gross, half-frozen gyoza block. Yuck!
